images.name: Pillars of Creation
images.description: A famous image of the Eagle Nebula's Pillars of Creation, taken by the Hubble Space Telescope.

images.name: Hubble Ultra Deep Field
images.description: An image of a small region of space in the constellation Fornax, revealing thousands of galaxies.

images.name: Andromeda Galaxy
images.description: The nearest spiral galaxy to the Milky Way and the largest galaxy in the Local Group.

images.name: Crab Nebula
images.description: A supernova remnant in the constellation of Taurus, observed by Chinese astronomers in 1054.

images.name: Helix Nebula
images.description: A planetary nebula located in the constellation Aquarius, often called the 'Eye of God'.

images.name: Whirlpool Galaxy
images.description: A classic spiral galaxy located in the constellation Canes Venatici, interacting with a smaller galaxy.

images.name: Sombrero Galaxy
images.description: A spiral galaxy in the constellation Virgo, known for its bright nucleus and large central bulge.

images.name: Pleiades Star Cluster
images.description: An open star cluster containing middle-aged, hot B-type stars in the constellation Taurus.

images.name: Orion Nebula
images.description: A diffuse nebula situated in the Milky Way, being one of the brightest nebulae visible to the naked eye.

images.name: Carina Nebula
images.description: A large, complex area of bright and dark nebulosity in the constellation Carina.

images.name: NGC 1300
images.description: A barred spiral galaxy located in the constellation Eridanus.

images.name: Horsehead Nebula
images.description: A dark nebula in the constellation Orion, part of the Orion Molecular Cloud Complex.

images.name: NGC 1672
images.description: A barred spiral galaxy in the constellation Dorado.

images.name: Messier 82
images.description: A starburst galaxy approximately 12 million light-years away in the constellation Ursa Major.

images.name: NGC 6302 (Butterfly Nebula)
images.description: A bipolar planetary nebula in the constellation Scorpius.

images.name: NGC 6217
images.description: A barred spiral galaxy in the constellation Ursa Minor.

images.name: Stephan's Quintet
images.description: A visual grouping of five galaxies of which four form the first compact galaxy group ever discovered.

images.name: NGC 1275 (M87)
images.description: A supergiant elliptical galaxy in the constellation Virgo.

images.name: NGC 5866
images.description: A lenticular galaxy in the constellation Draco.

images.name: Messier 106
images.description: A spiral galaxy in the constellation Canes Venatici.

images.name: Mercury
images.description: The smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun.

images.name: Venus
images.description: The second planet from the Sun, known for its thick, toxic atmosphere.

images.name: Earth From Space
images.description: An image of Earth taken from space, showing the beauty of our home planet.

images.name: Mars
images.description: The fourth planet from the Sun, known as the Red Planet.

images.name: Jupiter
images.description: The largest planet in the Solar System, known for its Great Red Spot.

images.name: Saturn
images.description: The sixth planet from the Sun, famous for its prominent ring system.

images.name: Uranus
images.description: The seventh planet from the Sun, known for its blue-green color and tilted axis.

images.name: Neptune
images.description: The eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun in the Solar System.

images.name: We Still Love Pluto
images.description: A dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt, known for its demotion from planet status.
